newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Manhattan Card FRCD raised to HK$500 mln.
newsitem.headline: Manhattan Card FRCD raised to HK$500 mln.

text.p: Manhattan Card Co's floating rate certificates of deposit issue due 2002 has been increased to HK$500 million from HK$400 million due to oversubscription, said arranger Chase Manhattan Asia.

The five-year certificates were issued at par and re-offered at a fixed 99.775. They pay a coupon of 45 basis points over the three-month Hong Kong Interbank Offered Rate. There are put and call options in year three and four.
With fees, the all-in return for top-tier managers is 54 basis points.
Arrangers are Chase Manhattan Asia, with HK$65 million, and J.P. Morgan Securities Asia and Schroders Asia, with HK$60 million each.

Co-lead managers are Banco Exterior de Espana's Hong Kong branch and Bank Austria's Hong Kong branch, with HK$50 million each, Banca Commerciale Italiana's Hong Kong branch, with HK$35 million, and Asahi Finance (Hong Kong), Banco Central Hispanoamericano's Hong Kong branch, Bayerische Vereinsbank's Hong Kong branch, Dresdner Bank's Hong Kong branch, Ka Wah Bank and Royal Bank of Scotland, with HK$30 million each.
